div.l: And Iohn also what doo ye nowe here
By god qduod Iohn nede hath no pere
Hym behouyth to s̉erue hym silf þat hath no swayn̄
Or elles he is a fool as Clerkys sayn̄
Our maunciple is sike ⁊and like for to be deed
So workys ay the wanges in his heed
And for thy // y am come and eke alayn̄
To grynde oure corn̄ ⁊and to carie mele agayn̄
Y pray you spede vs hens what ye may
It schal be doon̄ qduod Symkyn̄ be my fay
What woll ye doo / whiles it is in honde
By god right bi þe hoper woll y stonde
Quod Iohn / and see howe þe Corn goth yn̄
Yit sawe y neủer be my fader kyn
How þat þe hoper waggeth to and fro
Aleyn ansurred Iohn wolte þou soo
Þen woll y be benethe be my Croun̄
And see how þat þe mele falles doun̄
In to þe trowgh þat schal be my disport
For Iohn in feith y maybe of youre sort
I am as ille a Miller as ye bee
Þis myller smyleth at þere nycete
And thowgh al þis is doon but for a wile
Þei wene þat no man̄ schal hem begile
But be my thrifte yit schal y blere here eye
For all þe sleight of here Phlosophie
Þe more queynt crekes þat þei make
Þe more woll y stele whan y take
In stede of floure / yit wol y yeve hem bren̄
The grettest Clerkys be not wisest men̄
As whilom to þe wolf spake the mare
Of al here art compte y not a tare
Out att þe dore he goth ful pⁱriuyly
When he sawgh his tyme softly
He loked vp ⁊and doun̄ til he had founde
Þe Clerkes hors þer as it stood bounde
By hynde þe mylle vnder a leefsell
And to þe hors he goth faire and well
And stripith of þe bridell right anon̄
And when̄ þe hors was loos he gan to goon̄
Toward þe Fen̄ / þer as wilde mares renne
Forth wᵗith weehee // þrowgh thyk ⁊and thenne
This Miller goth agayn no woord he seide
But doth his besynes ⁊and wᵗith þe Clerkes pleide
Till þat here Corn was faire ⁊and well grounde
And when the mele was sackyd and y bounde
Þis Iohn Goth out and fyndith his hors awey
And gan to crie harowe and weleawey
Oure hors is loste / Aleyn for goddes bones
Steppe on þi feet / come on man all attones
Allas oure wardeyn̄ has his palfrey lorn̄
This Aleyn̄ all forgate boþe mele and corn̄
All was out of his mynde / his husbandrie
